Key Match Events: Netherlands defeated Bangladesh by 87 runs as they dismissed all the Bangladeshi players in just 142 runs, with 7.3 balls remaining at the Eden Gardens on 28 October, in the ongoing ICC World Cup 2023 tournament.
Paul van Meekeren took 4 wickets, Bas de Leede picked 2 wickets, while Colin Ackermann, Logan van Beek and Aryan Dutt clinched one wicket each for Netherlands.
Shoriful Islam, Taskin Ahmed, Mustafizur Rahman and Mahedi Hasan took two wickets each for Bangladesh, while skipper Shakib Al Hasan picked one wicket.
Pre-Game Insights: Both the Netherlands and Bangladesh have followed similar trajectories in the tournament, with just one win from their five matches.
Bangladesh, who have been without the services of captain Shakib al Hasan for most of the tournament, will be looking to settle their playing XI as they work to improve in both departments.
The Netherlands, meanwhile, will be looking to bounce back from a crushing defeat to five-time world champions Australia in their last outing.
Post-Match Reflections: Paul van Meekeren becomes ‘Player of the Match’ for picking up 4 wickets.
Bangladesh lost all their wickets at 142 and lost to Netherlands by 87 runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh and Netherlands Playing XI were mentioned in the article.
Bangladesh's deficiencies were exposed in their last match against South Africa, when the Proteas posted 382 runs in their 50 overs and dismissed the Bangladesh batsmen for a meagre score of 233.
The Australian batsmen put the Dutch bowlers to the sword, scoring 399 runs in their 50 overs.
